column10:
It's a lot worse than NBA 2k23. I thought the reviews were just an exaggeration, and mostly the negative reviews were talking about the online stuff and VC's. I bought this game because I thought it was updated and could hopefully play games realistically, just like in the NBA today. However, there are many reasons that didn't meet my requirements, and NBA 2k23 was better than this:

When selecting a team in play now, there's a player who will display while dribbling, but in 2k24, there's nothing.
When I changed my jersey, the court doesn't match the jersey, unlike in 2k23 where it matches the jersey.
The fonts are ugly.
It's quite unattractive in a way that it is not smooth (not talking about the framerates) and is sluggish.
There's no feedback when your shot is good or when it was contested.
There's a lot more, but this one is just what I could remember.

If you have an NBA 2k23 it's better to play NBA 2k23 than this. It's a lot better than 2k24.

Side comment: I rarely review games and whenever I do it's either the game is really good like really good or really bad. I also checked the reviews before purchasing and I'm the type of guy wherein It's your experience not mine maybe it's good for me and not for you but in here, the reviews are true. I was so frustrated because I really thought I could get an updated game just like in today's NBA game but no. It feels like 2k24 was just a modded older NBA 2k game with an updated roster. I tried playing the "play now" and "MyLeague" because i thought there's a difference between them but it's just the same. I couldn't get the black court with city jersey in GSW.

EDIT: I wrote a review right after I refunded this game.
mycarrer is just getting worse

[h1] DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! [/h1]

If you actually want to invest in a basketball game on PC, emulate an old 2K. 

2K hasn't properly ported the next-gen 2K (the PS5/Xbox Series X) onto Steam and it's been going to be 4 years since the era started. They also do this for their WWE series as well as they are about to release 2K24 with no intention of making it the proper generation with the new upgrades. There is absolutely zero reason why the old version is being charged for this amount other than pure laziness. It will not surprise me that 2K pulls the plug on selling 2K games on Steam in the future. This is also the first game I will refund in ages from my memory, in fact it could be the first game I have ever refunded if my memory is that horrible.

Genuinely do not buy this game, even when it's on sale. Don't even buy it for a dollar. They don't update the mechanics, photos, graphics, etc. People always meme about how 2K makes the same game every year, but with these ports I legitimately don't see a difference from 2K21 to 2K24 other than the jumpshot meter in terms of gameplay. It is also extremely bland in quality. For example, back in older versions the after basket camera cuts/transitions used to be very cool and bright, but now in this its just a boring black and white auto-generated player image from the game with no color to it. It's unironically just an updated roster every year port in the laziest way possible, and I feel anyway sorry who is willing to pay $60 for this worthless abomination and sorry excuse of a game.

Either pay for a console and pay for the next-gen (which even then I don't think is worth $60 considering how boring the basketball video game genre is now) or emulate a 2K game on a emulator. There's a reason why the reviews are mostly negative and believe me they are accurate. In fact, I take that back. I find it astonishing that people are giving this game a thumbs up. I have no clue how they can even think such a god awful product deserves a rating like that. The 22% has to be trolls, sports video game addict losers, or 2K themselves. There is nothing positive about this product and anyone who thinks there is a singular positive thing that this game provides to society needs to be deported from not only their country but from this planet and sent to Mars. An embarrassment to the Steam Store page and it's the first game where I ever had zero expectations and it still disappointed me.

Man!

Guys, you know, I can't believe how fast 20 years went by. This is crazy. This is absolutely crazy. And to be standing here at center court with you guys, my teammates behind me and appreciating all this, the journey that we've been on, we've been through our ups and been through our downs, and I think the most important part is that we all stayed together through out.

I grew up a die-hard, I mean a die-hard Laker fan. Die-hard. I mean, I knew everything about every player that's ever played here. So, to be drafted and then traded to this organization and to spend 20 years here, I mean, you can't write something better than this.

I'm prouder not about the championships, but about the down years. Because we didn't run. We didn't run. We played through all that stuff. We got our championships, and we did it the right way.

All I can do here is just thank you guys. Thank you, guys, for all the years of support. Thank you, guys, for all the motivation. Thank you for all the inspiration. You know, what's funny, the thing that had me cracking up all night long that the fact that I go through 20 years of everybody screaming to pass the ball and on the last night, they're like, 'Don't pass it.' This has been absolutely beautiful, you guys. I can't believe it's come to an end. You guys will always be in my heart and I sincerely, sincerely appreciate it. No words can describe how I feel about you guys.

Thank you, thank you from the bottom of my heart. I love you guys. I love you guys. To my family my wife Vanessa, my daughters Natalia and Gianna, thank you guys for all your sacrifices. For all the hours I spent in the gym working and training, and Vanessa, you're holding down the family the way that you have, I can't, there's no way that I can thank you enough. So, from the bottom of my heart, thank you.

And what can I say? Mamba out.

Look, I didn't buy this at full price because of the terrible reviews, but since it dropped to 12 bucks, I said why not.

I've played 3 other NBA 2k games before: 2k21, 2k22 and 2k19 (2k19 offline modes only) (2k21 on Switch, 22 and 19 on PS4). An optimist might think that this game might have smooth gameplay and a good myLeague/myGM mode like 2k19, or control nicely and have an amazing soundtrack like 22, or at least have a half-decent story like 21. All with the great graphics that 2k keeps advertising.
After a small bit of testing the game out, I found that instead, there's no story (it's the same as skipping the draft in other games, you just choose a team and start for them), the game feels clunky, slow and unintuitive, has crappy, cartoon-ish graphics, and I haven't played myLeague, but the fact that Starting Today and Starting in the offseason don't work, I don't need to. Plus the music sucks.

In only a few minutes, I have concluded that this is not [spoiler]just [/spoiler]the worst 2k ever- it is the worst game I have ever played in my entire life, and I've played[i] Zhu Zhu Pets: Quest For Zhu[/i]. This was an utterly horrible experience. Even for CAD 12.79 (+13% HST), this is a waste of money, and not worth it at all.

The new marketplace is horrible, 140,000 MT or 100,000 VC for a single card in a set of 5-15 cards to just get 1 card. The removal of auctions make trying to get these MT numbers impossible without buying MT or VC. Grinding rewards that are so minimal for the amount of time you have to put in is not worth it at all. I am not sure if they felt they were not getting enough money because progressing without paying is brutal. Yes, the shooting is difficult right now but that is because there are no good cards out yet. I will go back to 2k23 until better cards come out because grinding levels with these terrible cards is bad for my health.

UPDATE 2/23/2024: I have kept trying to give this game a chance because I really really want to enjoy this game but it just keeps becoming more and more of a money grab. Season 5 just came out, there is a level 100 and there are 98's but the only way to get those players is to buy packs. The same was with the All-Star packs, no 98s available in the player market, only 96s. 2k gives you 1/3 the MT back on spent cards so that you have to dump more money in to get the same level card you just sold. There is no way for you to try a card out before you buy the card and then do not like it, you lose MT for trying to use other cards. 2k has made it impossible for players to make any MT off currently held cards to try out other cards. This has become a pay to win game now that NMS players do not have an opportunity to get the highest cards in the game through grinding or being able to profit off cards they currently own. The shooting is better with better cards as I stated before but the money grab just gets worse.

I think this is my first ever review, and honestly.. I'm so disappointed in this game, that I actually needed to leave my input.
***DO NOT BUY UNLESS IT IS OVER 80% OFF, OR DO NOT BUY AT ALL***

The PC Version is VASTLY different from the Console Versions.. I don't even think it's the same game, honestly.
-myCareer story? Nope.
-Explore the Locker Room? Nope.
-Select what Jerseys you want to play in? Nope. (Yes, This has been patched Oct 21, 2023)
-Accessories for away games? Nope. (This Has Been Fixed)
-Graphics are identical to 2k22, maybe even 2k20. Officially dubbing it "Last Gen" Graphics, since it's embarrassing to still have nothing from the now Current Generation of consoles (PS5, Xbox Series X).
- The Rec is actually unplayable. I have waited more than 30min to find a match, with no way to leave the matchmaking screen once you "Have teammates". AKA, *MAYBE* one or 2 real players, and then auto-filled AI Teammates. Literally a useless game mode. (Added on Dec 1, 2023. *THIS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE LAUNCH OF THE GAME.*)


I held off to buy this years game because I didn't see anything I wanted in 2k23.
I didn't think I would get duped into buying a game through false advertisements.
"You're going to have all these things! ... ooh, you're on PC though, so.. here's a re-skinned 2k22. But thanks for your hard earned money for this 'New' instalment of the franchise!"

This version should be 1/2 the listed price, since PC players got less than HALF of the sick features that Consoles received.
This game is Highway ROBBERY at full price.

Final Verdict, Feb. 2, 2024:
Do not purchase this game.
Some of the glitches and bugs were fixed up, however nothing else of importance has changed.
The only focus is on pushing out more purchasable cards in MyTeam, and not improving the game itself.

Again. Do not purchase this game.
I will continue to play this game until "Next Gen" graphics finally catch up to pc, (which will probably then be "Current Gen" by then, let's be honest) and only because I already own it, obviously.

Quick addition:

It's F I N A L L Y on sale, for $12.79 CAD (84% off) until March 7th, 2024. (Today is Feb. 22)
If you're desperate for a Roster Update after owning an older 2k for My Player, then it's worth the sale price.

Other than being on a deep sale of 80% off or more, I still CAN NOT RECOMMEND BUYING THIS GAME.
The company seems to have abandoned development for this version since November (Bug Fixes), but they still have the time to update exclusive items that you can buy with your hard earned VC, or real money.

If you play on PC, just know that it's a VASTLY lesser game than the console version.  I watch videos online showing builds, badges, intro animation, rivalries, etc., and a lot of it I just never see.  Want to spend money so you can feel left out? Buy the PC game.

On the plus side, the physicality of the game, and the strategy required to win, is greatly improved from the last game.  Team play is more emphasized, as it should be (I was wondering how they'd make Jokic a more dominant player, as he was pretty weak in '23).  However, this comes at a cost: I'm not sure if this is also a nerf from the PC game, but having an 80 dunk, and the defender behind you, moving slower, means you're about to inexplicably miss a layup from 2 feet.  I don't even try to dunk now unless there are no defenders, it's a completely losing play (maybe 20% success, and I'm being generous).  I'm not even sure the PC version has all  the animations it should to ensure smooth gameplay; this mind-boggling *extreme* difficulty in finishing (75 layup, superstar difficulty, layup timing off) makes no sense, is supremely frustrating, and of course, only applies to you, the player.  [Edit: even after starting a dunk animation - 85 rated - if the defender who is completely behind you can touch you, you will then stop dunking and transition to an awkward layup that always misses 
- horribly, infuriatingly broken]

Micro-transactions suck, the PC version is completely inferior, and the game devs are amazing, but apparently don't have anywhere near enough time for anything but console.

One of the worst 2K's I've experienced. My last 2K purchase was NBA 2K19. As the years went on I didn't bother buying the latest 2K releases; playing the same version as well as the newer versions at friends houses, I realized how much the game has changed in a negative way. I am deeply certain that most 2K developers have never played on hardwood, nor blacktops, to understand the physics and dynamics of basketball. Since when 2K and CS2 share the same mechanics? When a defender barely grazes me or is within 2 feet, my player slows down. Since when did players start slowing down once they broke their defender? Like who does that? Especially on fast breaks too. I have given this game a chance but it just brings me more frustration than FUN

Here are my list of reasons...

1.  NBA 2k24 PC version is not Next-Gen and is missing content that is provided in the PS5 version.  

They couldn't even put in the NEW SCOREBOARD.  Modders have made a version of the new scoreboard for PC before 2k.  How lazy can you be???  

Here's another example..
In MyTeam you can equip a Home / Away and Alternate Jersey...EVERYTIME 2k releases new Season Jerseys they only release 2 (Home & Away) with no Alternate Jersey...LMAO
They don't even know their own Game...SMH 



2.  NBA 2k24 PC costs the same price as the PS5 Next-Gen version meaning I'm paying more for less. #GREED  #FRAUD



3.  The Game has sooo many Bugs and even if you open a ticket with 2k Support (I have opened over 10 tickets) they eventually close your ticket without resolving the issue.

Here are some examples...
a)  Playing an opponent that has the same color or identical Jersey as you and getting a LOSS and potentially BANNED if you quit the game.    
b)  Cannot save the Camera view in Triple Threat even though there is a SAVE option
c)  Intermittent Game Freezes for 30+ seconds sometimes resulting in a mid-game crash
d)  Getting stuck in a loop in MyCareer when trying to play games with other Online Players
e)  Season 4 Jerseys # font is too big and doesn't display properly in game or Edit Screen on PC
f)  Matchmaking is terrible...You can have a Team of Emeralds and be forced to play against Pink Diamonds
g)  Cannot change the Camera View for MyCourt in MyCareer
h) Random Game Crashes to Desktop for no apparent reason
i)  The Badges and Playbooks are different on PC vs. PS5
j)  Some Menu Navigation options don't work on MyTeam PC (it says press LT or RT but nothing happens)
and so MUCH MORE....



4.  Too many Micro-Transactions
The Player Market (controlled by 2k)  that has replaced the Auction House is too expensive.  If you want to try out a new card...you will instantly lose 60% of the original value.  If you choose to sell the Card because you don't like it or want to get a better Player Card.  A 60% money grab by 2k for what!?!?!? #BigPimpin



5.  Too much Gambling 
(Game Pack Odds are questionable) 
Every Reward you receive after winning a game that has value is attached to a gambling component (spin the wheel, drop the ball, open the door) that is manipulated by 2k Sports to encourage you to spend money.

This is achieved by making you BUY crappy Player Packs with odds that are NOT in your favor after you DON'T get the Reward you actually wanted for winning the Game or completing the Challenge.  

When you purchase "Player Packs" YOU have less than 2% odds to get a Top Tier Card at a minimum cost of 4000 MT per Pack you BUY.  Your best chance to get a top Tier card at 13% odds costs 21000 MT per "Deluxe Player Pack"...OR...You can BUY a Top Tier Card for over 200000 MT (instant 60% loss in Value) if it isn't locked behind a PAYWALL of 800000 MT...LMAO

DO NOT BUY BASE PACKS...they are worthless!!!  (2k nerfed the odds so they are even worse)

OHHHHHHH...I forgot...
This is how much you earn per Game approximately...
The GRIND is REAL CRAZY!!
So your option is "SPEND REAL MONEY" or "NO LIFE" the Game
1 Triple Threat Game = 400 to 800 MT 
1 Clutch Time Game = 800 to 1200 MT
1 Domination Game 2500 to 4000 MT



6.  Gameplay is clunky and choppy with animations...it sometimes feels like there is a wall in front of you or that you got cement in your shoes.



7.  If you want to play MyTeam or My Career expect to pay a minimum of $500 over the 9 Seasons OR Have NO LIFE trying to GRIND out the GAME for FREE and still always be at a disadvantage vs. opponents who spend money on the GAME.



8.  The Game AI (Artificial Intelligence) can be overpowered making some Challenges impossible or extremely frustrating requiring the use of METAs which make the game irritating, boring and monotonous.  

All Star Difficulty is broken...the CPU fouls you, pushes you out of bounds, in-air collisions, clothesline you in mid-air = No Foul Call 
How is a 6 ft. 200 lb. Guard able to BULLY 7ft 280+lbs CENTERS?!?!   GTFOH

YOUR players feel like they should be playing in the "F-League"  They can no longer defend, dribble, move, pass, layup, dunk or shoot.  Once Again, all REWARDS worth getting are usually achieved on "All-Star" Difficulty.  In the meantime, the CPU can't miss a shot and does EVERYTHING FASTER and MORE EFFICIENTLY than YOU.

It is so noticeable and it becomes CLEAR 2k has done this on purpose.  2k plays with the animations and obviously the settings in any Challenge (Pro and All-Star) when the REWARD is good.  The difficulty feels so different...the game plays choppy especially when the AI is trying to CHEAT or Manipulate the Gameplay.

2k's goal is to frustrate you sooo much...that you SPEND money on Shortcuts (Buying Packs) which is the most scummiest form of MANIPULATION.  #Psychology

It feels like 2k is teasing you with a FREE Deluxe Pack that is extremely hard to get if at all.   It just makes me hate the game more and more each time I play it...It has to be the most unsatisfying experience I have ever had playing a game....compared to Forza 4 that rewards you constantly just for driving your car.

Remember this is on Pro or All-Star Difficulty...
I dare you to try HOF Domination...You will probably break your Controller or Monitor...SMH

It makes me wonder if 2K really wants us to play their game or complete Challenges...
Of Course not...there is no MONEY for them in that.  



9.  Multiplayer Modes can be very choppy making it difficult to time your shots 
Shooting is more harder in NBA2k24 than in previous versions and some of the BEST REWARDS are provided in Multiplayer Mode...LMAO  

I don't even waste my time doing Multiplayer Challenges any more because it gets me so irritated.  The VARIABLE SHOT TIMING and SHOT CONTEST SYSTEM is HORRIBLE...I miss perfect Green Shots, Free Throws and Layups.   Anyone who tells you shooting is EASY is LYING or CHEATING...lol

Think about it...2k get numerous complaints about their SERVERS but they still make the best REWARDS available ONLY through MULTIPLAYER...how tone deaf can 2k be????



10.  The players you REALLY want in MyTeam or give you the best chance of success are locked behind a PAYWALL...

Sellable and Unsellable Player Cards...???
Let me make it simple...
Cards you BUY are usually Sellable...MOST cards you Win or are REWARDED are Unsellable.  

Unsellable cards have more limitations in regards to VALUE, applying additional Badges and in some cases cannot be used in Exhibitions or The Exchange.  Cards that YOU purchase do not have these limitations.

Every other game I play manages to find a balance between Challenge / Monetization / Player Enjoyment.  2k has lost touch with the Player Base and thinks that it's ok to spend THOUSANDS of DOLLARS a Year to play a BROKEN Video Game that is COPY and PASTE  of last year (The same bugs in the game for YEARS) 



Spending Thousands of dollars on a basketball video game that is released annually with no carryover of YOUR ACHIEVEMENTS, YOUR VC or YOUR MT = $$$$$$ in the TOILET and TONS of WASTED TIME.
Yes!!! 
People have even posted receipts online of spending over 5k on an NBA 2k game....That is INSANE!!!

I can go on forever but it's not worth my time...I wasted enough already.


2k has taken the fun out of this game...All they care about is making money and not the Quality of Product they sell....That is more than obvious.  

If there is a mistake in pricing or a Reward that they feel we don't deserve... 2k will fix it in MINUTES... Game-breaking bugs that affect Gameplay and QOL (Quality of Life) are fixed WHENEVER... 

If you buy or own NBA 2k24...play "No money spent" or the other OFFLINE Modes.
Save YOUR MONEY and buy a CAR or a HOUSE...lmao

I'm someone who buys NBA2k every couple of years when i'm looking for that sports game itch (only when it drops to $15 or less, never brand new). I usually enjoy playing the story mode with my created player, so to find out that there is zero story in this game was really disappointing. Having to jump into the starting lineup of an NBA team as a 60 overall player is just cruel. I don't usually play online (even though I would like to) because it takes a ridiculous amount of time to level up your player unless you spend a lot of money. In previous years it took a while to level up but it was do-able. In this game it is actually insane how slow progression is. If you're a casual player like me, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. This game literally made me pull out my Xbox 360, wipe off the dust and play NBA 2k13 for the first time in a decade, and I had a blast! Micro-transactions have ruined sports games.

As you can see, i've played this game for a quite long time. Here's my review.

1. GAMEPLAY & CONTENT
I wouldn't consider this a game, none of the content is fun. The thing is.. i'm not sure if it even has content at all. My career without story is more like a "play now" with your own created player. MyTeam challenges is the same every year. The difficulty seems strange, at some point the game is very hard on semi-pro level and is easier on all-star. Sometime the pro, all-star, and HOF difficulty is very hard to play. It makes you feel like the game is scripted to make you lose in a strange way (AI draining half court contested shot on a winning buzzer situation). Your player misses open three and layup on slightly late or early even though it's not on HOF difficulty.

2. ANIMATION, MODEL, and ISSUES
Game is full of bugs and glitches that is not fixed by the 2K developer on every update. The animation doesn't look natural and sometimes causes in game error. Even the modelling of the character is buggy. One of my player is even playing with partially naked chest. Player's hair is not updated, player's torso is rendered outside the jersey, jersey is not stretched in a natural way. I can name 10 or 20 more animation or modelling glitches. Last but not least, when you play myCareer, once you get subbed, it will stuck and the game play is on slow motion. You can't sub back in because the menu or the action button doesn't appear, and this happens LITERALLY EVERY GAME.

3. PERFORMANCE
I'm playing with a good PC, but sometimes the FPS drop even though i have adjust the most suitable graphics options. I think the system that they created is very complex and should be optimized ASAP. I also play on a stable connection with high speed wifi, but the loading takes me like 5 minutes before going back to the menu. It takes me around 10-20 minutes on some worst cases. Even if you play offline, the loading is still taking eternity to complete which is weird. On multiplayer, it gets even worse. It's very choppy and laggy, you cannot even score. I realize that the lobby has many servers all across the country, but the ping is not playable no matter which server you're playing at.

To conclude all these, i wouldn't recommend everyone playing this game even if it's free. Very lack of fun and frustrating. Play basketball in real life, everyone can play better in real life. Why would somebody put one of the best athlete on the worst sport game ever exist... disrespectful...

We don't need yearly sports titles but it continues to happen because of greed. No other genres have this type of release pace. Its not 1995 and we can update rosters with a patch. VC is also an absolute joke. Its nearly impossible to grind this game and for some reason it feels harder every year.

On PC we are stuck getting the same last gen game over and over with slightly different skins. I get it, according to the steam hardware survey PC gamers are regularly gaming on older GPUss. But this is a 60fps locked game (online). Anything over 4 gigs of vram should do fine paired with a quad core cpu with modern instruction sets. Only buy this game on sale.

Cost: Video games, including NBA 2K24, can be expensive. Some players may find the cost prohibitive or feel that the value offered doesn't justify the price.

Microtransactions: NBA 2K games, like many others, often include in-game purchases or microtransactions. Some players may be averse to this model, feeling that it can lead to an imbalanced playing field or an excessive focus on spending real money within the game.

Repetitive Gameplay: Some players may feel that the gameplay mechanics or features in NBA 2K24 are too similar to previous versions, leading to a sense of repetition and lack of innovation.

Technical Issues: Video games can sometimes have technical problems, such as bugs, glitches, or server issues. If players experience frequent technical difficulties, it can detract from the overall gaming experience.

Time Commitment: Playing video games, especially sports simulation games like NBA 2K24, requires a significant time commitment. Some individuals may prefer to spend their time on other activities or may not have the time available for gaming.

Preference for Other Genres: Not everyone enjoys sports simulation games. Some players may prefer other genres of video games, such as action, adventure, role-playing, or strategy games.

Ultimately, whether or not to buy or play NBA 2K24 is a personal decision based on individual preferences, priorities, and values. If you have specific concerns or reasons for avoiding the game, you may want to explore alternative gaming options that align better with your preferences.

This is so bad. I mainly play MyCareer in 2k and it doesn't have cut scenes at all (current gen). After creating your player and choosing your team, you just receive a letter from the organization saying how they wanted you and you'll be put in the starting line up immediately. Im so glad I bought the game when it was on sale because this isn't worth the original price for me at all. If you still want to play this game then buy it when its on sale. NBA 2K24 is exactly the consistent product you can expect from 2k, year after year. here are some highlights of this year's version:
- did they update the rosters? YES KIND OF
- did they make sure the pictures on the main menus had players on their current team? NO
- did they update the graphics? NO
- did they update the menus? YES, WORSE
- did they update myteam? YES THEY REMOVED THE AUCTION HOUSE, PAY THEM OR LOSE LOL
- did they dumb down myplayer? YES
- is there at least still a storyline to myplayer? NO
- can you do a wnba myleague? NO 
- can you do a wnba myplayer? NO
- did they fix any common crashes? NO
- i got a faster hard drive, are loading times better? SOMEHOW ALSO NO
- can you run over 60fps? NO IT WILL CRASH
- did they screw with shot timing again so you're not as good as you were last year? YES OF COURSE
- did they at least add anticheat or ban cheaters? NO OF COURSE NOT
- is there a bunch of shameless plugs and graphics to profit off of kobe's memory? YES SO MUCH
- why do they keep doing this? I DON'T KNOW

Stephen Hawking was a brilliant theoretical physicist, cosmologist, and author who made significant contributions to our understanding of the universe. His research and insights have had a profound impact on the field of theoretical physics, and he has become one of the most recognizable figures in the scientific community. In this essay, we will explore the historical context, key figures, the impact of Stephen Hawking, and influential individuals who have contributed to the field of theoretical physics. We will also discuss various perspectives on Stephen Hawking and provide a well-reasoned analysis that covers both positive and negative aspects, as well as potential future developments related to his work.
Historical context:
Stephen Hawking was born on January 8, 1942, in Oxford, England. He attended University College, Oxford, where he studied natural science. He then went on to pursue graduate studies in cosmology at the University of Cambridge, where he became interested in the Big Bang theory and the origins of the universe. In 1963, at the age of 21, Hawking was diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), a progressive neurodegenerative disease that left him paralyzed and unable to speak without the use of a voice synthesizer. Despite the challenges he faced, Hawking continued his research and made significant contributions to the field of theoretical physics.
Key figures:
Throughout his career, Stephen Hawking collaborated with many key figures in the field of theoretical physics. One of his most notable collaborations was with Roger Penrose, a renowned mathematician and physicist who worked with Hawking on the singularity theorems and the nature of black holes. Hawking's work with Penrose laid the foundation for our current understanding of black holes and the behavior of gravitational singularities. Other key figures in Hawking's life and career include his colleagues and students at the University of Cambridge, where he held the prestigious position of Lucasian Professor of Mathematics from 1979 to 2009.
Impact of Stephen Hawking:
Stephen Hawking's work has had a profound impact on the field of theoretical physics and our understanding of the universe. His groundbreaking research on black holes, the nature of spacetime, and the origins of the universe has opened up new avenues of exploration for scientists and researchers. Hawking's best-known work, "A Brief History of Time," has helped popularize complex scientific concepts and make them accessible to a wider audience. His work has also inspired countless individuals to pursue careers in science and academia, and his contributions to the field of theoretical physics have been recognized with numerous awards and honors.
Influential individuals in theoretical physics:
In addition to Stephen Hawking, there have been many influential individuals who have contributed to the field of theoretical physics. One of the most influential figures is Albert Einstein, whose theory of general relativity laid the foundation for much of the current research on black holes and the behavior of spacetime. Other influential individuals include Richard Feynman, who made significant contributions to quantum mechanics, and Edward Witten, who has made groundbreaking advances in the field of string theory. These individuals, along with many others, have helped shape the field of theoretical physics and have influenced the direction of research and exploration.
Perspectives on Stephen Hawking:
Stephen Hawking's work has been met with a range of perspectives, both positive and negative. On the positive side, Hawking is widely admired for his intelligence, perseverance, and ability to communicate complex scientific concepts to a general audience. His work has inspired a new generation of scientists and has brought theoretical physics into the public eye. However, there are also criticisms of Hawking's work, particularly his stance on the nature of black holes and the information paradox. Some researchers believe that Hawking's conclusions may need to be revised in light of new evidence and theoretical developments.
Analysis and future developments:
In analyzing the impact of Stephen Hawking's work, it is important to consider both his contributions and the potential for future developments in theoretical physics. While Hawking's research has provided valuable insights into the nature of black holes and the behavior of spacetime, there are still many unanswered questions in the field. Future developments in theoretical physics may involve new theories of quantum gravity, advancements in string theory, and a deeper understanding of the fundamental forces of the universe. It is also possible that advances in technology and observational techniques will allow us to test and refine our current theories, providing new insights into the nature of the cosmos.
In conclusion, Stephen Hawking was a pioneering figure in the field of theoretical physics whose work has had a profound impact on our understanding of the universe. His collaborations with key figures, such as Roger Penrose, have advanced our knowledge of black holes and the behavior of spacetime. While there are various perspectives on Hawking's work, it is clear that he has inspired a new generation of scientists and has helped make complex scientific concepts accessible to the public. As we look to the future, it is important to continue building on Hawking's contributions and exploring new avenues of research in theoretical physics. By doing so, we can continue to expand our understanding of the universe and uncover new insights into the fundamental nature of reality.
Basketball Players: The Impact of a Dominant Force in Sports
Basketball is a sport that has captivated the hearts of millions around the world. The fast-paced, high-flying action of the game has made it a staple in the sports world. Every team has their own set of stars—the players who carry the weight of the team and set the stage on fire with their incredible talents. These players become idols for basketball enthusiasts, as they carve out legacies that stretch across generations. In this essay, we will delve into the historical context of basketball, identify key figures in the sport, discuss the impact of basketball players, and analyze influential individuals who have contributed to the field of basketball players. We will also explore various perspectives on the sport and provide a well-reasoned analysis, covering both positive and negative aspects, while considering potential future developments related to basketball players.
Historical Context
The history of basketball dates back to the late 1800s, when Dr. James Naismith, a physical education instructor, invented the game as a way to keep his students active during the cold winter months. The first official game of basketball was played on December 21, 1891, in Springfield, Massachusetts. From those humble beginnings, basketball has evolved into a global phenomenon, with professional leagues in countries all over the world.
In the early days of basketball, players were predominantly white, and the sport was not as diverse as it is today. However, as the sport gained popularity, it began to attract players from all ethnic backgrounds. This diversity has contributed to the rich tapestry of talent that exists in the world of basketball today.
Key Figures
Throughout the history of basketball, there have been countless players who have left an indelible mark on the sport. From the early legends like George Mikan and Bill Russell, to modern superstars like LeBron James and Stephen Curry, these players have shaped the game and inspired countless others to follow in their footsteps.
The impact of basketball players can be seen both on and off the court. On the court, they have demonstrated extraordinary skill and athleticism, thrilling fans with their gravity-defying dunks,

Although it's still not "next gen" I'm still going to give this game a thumbs up. I hated 2k23 one of the worst things about it were the RNG shooting and adrenaline bars. In this game, that's fixed. As long as you time your shot perfectly, you can make anything that's not 100% smothered, and personally, I like that way better. You don't lose an adrenaline bar from doing basic dribbles anymore. And the layup meter closes in or out depending on how contesting you are midair, meaning and1s are actually makeable something with 3 point and1s. The Ais actually feel like real NBA players; instead of being a straight brick, they actually make shots. Of course, with all this, there are some shots that are kind of odd and shouldn't go in that these Ais make, but at least for me, thats rare, and the only couple of ones Ive seen was when luka made a logo three that was 43% contested, but he did avg 40 pts, so ig 2k. One thing I dislike is that I legit get a clean block on someone, and the refs will call a foul, and even when I challenge it, the call stands, and there are a lot of refs that will rig fouls. Another thing is the free throw rework. Instead of being able to green a free throw its RNG i have a big man with a 51 free throw. I could full bar it, and it would say 71% and brick, and then the next one would say excellent release, 71%. So unless you have curry at the line, its rng for free throw greens. There are also more dunk animations, crossovers, stepbacks, and overall, a lot more animations. For right now, at least with the game being on sale for 21 bucks, I think it's a game you should get if you like basketball.

Next gen for pc!!!

shooting mechanics them self seem a little better in some ways but still terrible in others. There is actually visible green in most shots now but the green moves so much its too much sometimes. Its also very lob/post heavy game as its the only easy way to score. I had lots of struggles breaking down or driving past any type of defender. Its also impossible to shoot mid-range if you don't have a 6'10 shooter with the proper shooting badges. I thought this was suppose to be a fun game for us to enjoy our imagination of playing in the nba but we don't need to make the game so realistic to the point that we are also being robbed of the idea. We want to be able to play as our idols such as Dirk Nowitzkis mid-range leaner over defenders, Koby Bryants spin jump shot, Kyrie Irvings crazy handles to break ankles. But I have tried all these characters and have failed to pull any of these off more than once in a game!!! Why???? Why does this have to be so difficult for us who want to live thru these games. I'm trying to have fun but the games now days have become too focused on the wrong things and have ignored a lot of what the community has to say! The online is also too flashy and lagging. Id much rather there be a new 2k every other year to have a quality over quantity focus.

NBA 2K24, the latest installment in the popular basketball video game franchise, has generated significant discontent within the gaming community. Despite the franchise's history of delivering immersive and engaging basketball simulations, 2K24 has faced substantial criticism from players who feel that the game falls short of expectations. This essay aims to explore the reasons behind the community's dissatisfaction, drawing upon factual evidence and feedback from players.

Microtransactions and Virtual Currency (VC) Exploitation:
One of the primary grievances within the NBA 2K24 community revolves around the pervasive presence of microtransactions and the exploitation of virtual currency. Players argue that the game heavily favors those willing to spend real money on VC, creating an uneven playing field. This financial model not only impacts the overall gaming experience but also raises ethical concerns about the fairness of competition.

Unresponsive Gameplay and Glitches:
Complaints about the gameplay mechanics in NBA 2K24 are abundant, with players expressing frustration over unresponsive controls, inconsistent player animations, and a plethora of glitches. These issues undermine the realism and fluidity that the franchise is known for, contributing to a sense of dissatisfaction among the player base.

Unbalanced Player Ratings and Attributes:
The community has raised concerns about the imbalanced player ratings and attributes in NBA 2K24. Many players argue that certain characters are either overpowered or underpowered, disrupting the game's balance and making it difficult for users to enjoy a fair and competitive experience.

Lack of Meaningful Innovation:
While players expect each new installment to bring innovative features and improvements, NBA 2K24 has been criticized for its lack of meaningful innovation. The game appears to recycle many elements from its predecessors, leaving players yearning for fresh and exciting additions that would enhance the overall gaming experience.

Disconnect Between Developers and Community:
Some members of the NBA 2K24 community argue that there is a notable disconnect between the game developers and the player base. They feel that the developers are not adequately addressing the community's concerns or implementing feedback, leading to a sense of frustration and alienation.

Conclusion:

In conclusion, NBA 2K24 has faced substantial criticism from its community, and the reasons behind this discontent are rooted in tangible issues such as microtransactions, gameplay glitches, unbalanced player attributes, a lack of innovation, and a perceived disconnect between developers and players. While the franchise has a history of delivering high-quality basketball simulations, the shortcomings of 2K24 have left many fans disappointed and eager for improvements in future releases. As the gaming industry evolves, it is essential for developers to actively engage with their communities, listen to feedback, and strive for continuous improvement to ensure the longevity and success of their franchises.

I have NBA 2K24 on PS5, but for the sale price offered at the time, I wanted to grab it on Steam to see how it plays in ultrawide and on the Steam Deck. Well, after an hour of gameplay, I asked for a refund.

It really is a downgrade from PS5/Xbox Series X. I can ignore the ProPlay animations the next-gen consoles have, but the game just isn't pretty. I feel the brightness is turned up, and it looks overexposed. Also, the game is missing a lot of graphical touches. For example, when the game first launched, the Triple Threat scoreboard looked VERY basic. When Season 2 launched, 2K updated the scoreboard on console and it looks great. However, even in Season 3 now, the PC scoreboard still has that ugly launch scoreboard. I feel like if 2K can't update a scoreboard in the game, what else are they not caring about?

Also, for some reason, I feel the FPS when navigating the menus feels fast. I guess that's a nitpick. But, speaking of the menus, they are just so basic compared to the presentation on PS5/Series X. Sure, maybe another nitpick since it's menus, but another case I feel 2K is taking a less effort approach with NBA 2K24.

Do I recommend NBA 2K24? Yes. I love this game. Do I recommend it on PC? No. Wait to see if 2K finally gives PC gamers the true experience.

This game is really fun, so I'd recommend it. That being said, as someone who's never played 2k before, MyCareer sucks. During the builder, it never tells you that you have to get to 99 potential before you can move on, so it just seems like you're stuck. Then, once your character is created, it just drops you into the middle of the online world without giving you any direction at all. How do I meet my agent? How do I kick off the plot? Why am I randomly guarding Michael Jordan when my character is 60 overall? I genuinely have no idea what's going on. It feels like the creators dropped a dozen different games & challenges, but don't tell you a single thing about any of them. If you've never played this game before, godspeed.

Despite the same game and price tag, I would say this game is completely different on PC than on PS5, and is a much worse game in the PC version. 

FIrstly, the video quality and athlete's appearance are significantly worse than PS5, despite tweaking to the highest settings in PC. In addition, the PC version lack features and functions that is present in the PS5 version, such as holding onto the rim by holding on to R2, after a dunk, which is not included in the PC version.  Furthermore, the playing court of blacktop of the PC version is not what is shown on the screenshots, which supposedly should include the sideline audience crowd, drones and the much better court graphics, but instead in the PC version, the same old blue court which has been the same over the last 3 versions of NBA 2K, showing obvious reluctance of game developers in improving the game on the PC version. I have always been a fan of NBA 2K, but in terms of the gameplay experience this year I would say that it is an inferior game on the PC version, and has shown the laziness of 2K game developers in bringing the gameplay experience across all platforms. Last but not least, the roster on the NBA 2K24 PC version is NOT UP TO DATE (in contrast the 2K24 PS5 roster is much better managed).

Graphics are better. That's about all you can say for it. No story in career mode. That's what 70% of the players buy the game for. It's inexplicable really. They made some control changes but, after 20 hours, I can't say it's any better than before. They ruined the alley-opp as well. If you've never played this franchise or maybe it's been a number of years, it's probably worth a look. Don't think it's worth a $70 look though. Just wait till it goes on sale, which will be before you know it with all the negative reviews.
**Update:  After over 100 hrs I can't change anything I said previously. I will add random crashes to desktop to the list though. The challenge games you can play in Mycourt do add some variety, which is nice, though, due to the added grind, it will take some time before you can be competitive and start winning any of those games. Let's hope they bounce back next year.

Good things first: Visually all basketballers are looking fine. Like their real life personas. 
But now the bad things: Game is practically unplayable. After Season 3 Patch I can´t play any of those, what is in MyLeague section. Advance or Enter button is gone. There was problems of buttons earlier also. Esc button was total nightmare.
My Career is practically non-existent. It reminds me the games before NBA 2K started to make some storyline in the MyCareer. But it is non-existent, because, why You need play that, if there is no challenges. 
My League messed up with other saves. I had created team in My League. Everything was fine until I decided, that I try another created team also. Then I found out, that buttons doesn´t work and I can´t go through the Team Selection. But, when I turned back my old save, I noticed, that some elements of new is inside of that save. Team logo, arena and team shirts were changed. So when I tried to build the new team, it completely messed totally my old save. So I finally deleted it. But now I don´t have opportunity to play My League, like I told before. There is no Advance Button. 
Conclusion is this: Game needs fixing quickly. It is year of 2023 and it is impossible to understand, why there is so many problems and crashes. It is not the first game of the series. NBA 2K is made for years. Even if it is not Next Gen, there is people, who want to play in computer.

Big men are completely unplayable. 6'9 PF with 85 inside scoring and I consistently miss 2 foot layups over guards. the amount offensive 3 second calls that I get because there is someone who is 6'5 or taller in front of me in the paint is unbelievable. I don't dare try and take a shot because there is a almost zero percent chance of it going in so I get the 3 seconds when I hold my left joystick towards the closest edge of the paint only for my character to decide to start moving after 2 seconds. I have to mention this great new animation introduced into this 2k where you can have a step on a defender and be between them and the basket, you know wide open fucking look. And then you gather the ball and the defender magically slides right in front of your player causing you to take some contested push shot instead of the incredibly easy layup that is inside of the restricted circle. Idk if It's because my player doesn't have that many badges yet but its seriously so un-fun, frustrating and just straight up not playable that I can't be asked to play it. its funny that people are dissing this game for being a lazy cash grab asset flip of old gen games that insults the PC players, as if that hasn't been the case with 2k on pc for the last 3 years. Dont know why this year its suddenly an issue. I hate this game for many more things beyond the lazy cash grab it is.

 Beyond the shameless wallet swiping of MC and MT to try and steal your money is annoying enough, the gameplay this year takes maybe the worst step back since 18. While random jumpshot release timings are gone, its been replaced by the stickiest CPU defense since 2K16 HOF and the complete nerfing of big men and slashers.

You simply cannot get open in any 1 on 1 situation unless you are using elite level ball handlers and spam snapback dribble combos until you get a stagger animation. Big men cannot finish over smaller guards on switches, big men cannot do any post moves or finishes unless your Jokic and Embiid, and guards cant finish a layup if there is a big man within 3 feet of them standing on the ground like this is 2K 21. 2Ks constant push for 41-38 final scores online seems to continue.

Once again Steph Curry has killed the perfect game balance that was 2k 14 PS4/Xbox1 version. Unless your steph good luck hitting any sort of  jumpshot while moving or off flare screens or gather jump shots from any distance. Everyone else turns into Russel Westbrook when shooting if there is a defender within 4 country miles of you and the RNG jumpshot timing comes back if your """defended""". I do not know what it will take to get an actual balanced gameplay experience and not just tweaking animation probability and playing with defensive effectiveness sliders every year. 

CPU defense is the strongest its been in years which means good luck playing online games where players aren't exploiting double teams and CPU pass lane lockdown coach settings and hiding off the ball (if they arent just hacking outright) and abusing snapback dribble combos on offense. Another year, another BS online experience with the same garbage prehistoric netcode thats been used since 2k11 on PS3\360.

I miss the times when you could jump into 2k and players could actually do things on offense even if they weren't 95 overalls or higher. I miss when players actually felt unique and had special skillsets. I miss when bigmen could finish dropstep layups over 6'2 guards. I miss when paid professional basketball players not named Steph Curry could hit a jumpshot without having no defender within 3 miles of them. I miss when user controlled defense trumped CPU defense and was actually stick skill based. Does anyone else miss that or is it just me?

Oh also the Kobe challenges are mostly all the same with stupid requirements like getting 3 steals in addition to your 65 points and lockdown defense on other star players. Its insulting to everyone involved.

Another year, another garbage 2K that further erodes the amazing foundation that games like 2K 12,13,14, 15, and 16 perfected to a mirror sheen. Yes the aggressive micropayment trash is worse then ever, but its nothing new for this series and most outlets are about 7 years too late on reporting on that harshly to make any difference. Theres fundemental issues with the gameplay that needs to be addressed first and foremost that most people seem to ignore.

Still gonna play the hell outta this game tho cause im a glutton for punishment and love basketball. but still, to hell with this series and to Take-Two itself.

Unless you want to play MyTeam or a storyless 2k23 MyCareer, stay away from the game. The MyCareer feels so soul-sucking, it seriously is bland, lifeless, and is basically old MyCareer (2k13 story) with current player building (which limits your stats and badges to a "99" overall) onto the same map from 2k23 except worse. 

The MyCareer is advertised as a limitless and personalized experience, it's neither. You can build your character with the same builder from Next-gen 2k23, and then you're told by the team you pick to draft you, that they believe in you! Watch the Chris Smoove video for 2k24, it shows how you're this hyped prospect and I will say, 2k24 for Next-Gen looks amazing. I don't have a next-gen machine (PC should be one, but it isn't because 2k thinks it isn't), so I bought it for PC because of MyTeam and because the $150 pre-order had a 12 month NBA League pass sub (which I don't know how to get), other than that I was just going to buy the game at some point. But the MyCareer isn't Next-gen, it's obvious 2k is pushing people to buy Next-gen, and that's where all the effort is going. For this MyCareer just from a game and using the same Neighborhood from last year (except there is even less effort put into it), I can tell it won't have much in it. I had 5 cutscenes in 2k23 (from my Xbox One) by the time my first game was over, now there is none. It's not the same story, it's no story. 

2k advertising the MyCareer how they are on Steam should be illegal.

Also MyTeam is drastically different. There is no auction house, and players cost 55k (Ruby Andre Iguodala discounted from 70k woo!).

Edit: I've played about 40 or so hours across MyTeam, MyLeague, and MyCareer. This game seriously stinks. There are countless unfixed bugs/issues from past games, and more issues too. MyLeague had this issue on old gen (at least) where it would tell you a player couldn't be traded until Dec 15, yet you could be in January and it would say that. The game itself has a new issue where many windows you bring up (like draft scouting in MyLeague) don't display correctly, about half of the window isn't readable and is covered by other windows. Yet 2k won't ever fix these issues. They've persisted for years. Horrible business practice. It sucks that such a horrible company has a monopoly on a sport.

Another edit: The game is just getting worse. MyLeague is unplayable, and that's half of what I play. I can't draft players because the game crashes everytime I try to pick, many of the critical menus are unreadable because other menus overlap them. It's just awful. This game is the product of zero competition.

[b] 2K's greed and inability to innovate makes the PC experience insufferable. [/b]

[b] Core issue [/b]
You cant compete online unless you spend €150 or grind an insane amount of career (60hrs). Thats for one build then when you realise your build is ass, you got to repeat the process. 2K has created this system to force you into micro-transactions. Alongside buying the game you are spending [b]  + €150 on a build + €20 for a season pass. That is €200+ to even begin to enjoy the game [/b]. This will not change, they will not reduce VC prices as the system is successful and they have a monopoly over the Basketball game market. 2K advertises influencer builds within load screens and on their social media pages encouraging their practise. 
 
[b] Neglect of PC [/b]
We are still on last-gen and without crossplay. This is because of 2K's inability to spend money on an anti-cheat system and laziness for the third year running. The excuse on their end is a majority of the player-bases PC's cant handle it yet the game is not hard to run in the slightest on low settings. Because of the horrible engine the game breaks itself when above 60HZ or without VSYNC turned on. MyCareer will bug and become slow motion not allowing sim to next appearance. Its time they spent the money they rob from their community on investing in bringing next gen to the PC, a solid anti cheat and bringing the game in line with modern hardware.

[b] Delay [/b]
When playing career the jump-shot timing is consistent and you can build up a solid jumper. This timing however changes when playing online and you are constantly having to guess the timing of your shot. This could be a me problem but I have fibre connection with good hardware. Some people on the park seem to be prime Larry Bird and others cant hit anything.

[b] It wont change [/b]
I have been waiting for years for the PC community to get an upgrade yet I acknowledge it will not arrive. I held off buying the game but decided to try due to sale. 2K have realised that hiding behind the hardware excuse prevents them from investing their money in a solid anti cheat, updating their engine and having to respond to the console players anxiety over a cheater influx from PC. The game is a cash generator for the company, no protest will prevent change unless NBA Live comes back and forces them to adapt to competitors.

[b] Positives (hahahaha) [/b]
The genuinely only enjoyable component is Blacktop yet here you cant even play online. Blacktop runs solid and can give you the basketball fix, yet the mode is identical to the Arcade version for mobile. Save yourself €60 and just hook up your controller to the €5 mobile version I promise you the experience is identical.

Overall 2K wont change and the predatory business tactics dictate the direction of the game. There is no defence for a company as evil.

**Edit** 10/21/23

The game is still more or less unplayable for MyLeague. IF it doesn't crash when I try to load the save file, I can no longer play past the 1-2 quarters before it will hard crash. It has persisted across multiple save files, and multiple reinstalls. The game is broken. 

I genuinely don't understand how 2K managed to completely break a game they have literally copy-pasted the last 5 years but somehow they did. I'm going to be seeking a refund from Steam and this will probably be my last 2K that I pay for. 

**Edit** 

Three weeks in, and all of these issues are still occurring. I'm currently updating this as I struggle with YET AGAIN my Myleague save crashing when I tried to reload it. Now, I am stuck in a seemingly endless loop where my controller will not be detected (forcing me to force close and keep relaunching until it randomly is), and then IF my controller is detected, I try to load my MyLeague save and the game crashes. lmao. JFC

__________

Loading any MyLeague save completely crashes the game more times than not. Usually I have to reload the game multiple times for it to finally let me access it. It basically makes the mode completely unplayable. 

So far, I have had a lot of trouble making it past the second quarter while playing MyLeague, I have only played a handful of games so far (since I was dealing with the other issues). but so far they have all crashed when the first quarter ends or second quarter starts. 

My PS5 controller is detected sometimes, sometimes not. No rhyme or reason, it will either detect when I start the game, or not, causing me to have to restart the game (sometimes repeatedly) until it detects it again. 

The ability to see available minutes is gone in the coaching section of MyLeague (where you assign minutes). It was there last year, i am assuming this is a bug. 

They removed the ability to name your MyLeague saves after 2K22, and this game has not re-implemented it. This is honestly one of the most infuriating thing that pisses me off about this game series. We HAD the option for several games before these last two. It is seriously one of the most BASIC quality of life options. It is vital for someone like me, who makes a lot of backups and alternate saves. There is NO reason or excuse for this change. None. The current iteration gives you literally every other piece of info you don't need (record, standing, team name, etc) EXCEPT the ability to just rename your save -- the ability we already have BEFORE! 

Somehow the game looks considerably worse than before. I have no idea how you even pull that off given each game has been almost a complete copy-paste of 2K20. 

Player's faces still look goofy as ever.

The lighting is AWFUL.

Almost all of the music is quite literal hot garbage made by artists with little to no real talent. This isn't a new thing, it's been that way for the most part the better part of a decade now. What cracks me up is not only the fact they have to censor the lyrics so much in so many of the songs that at times they almost become instrumental versions. It's also that they often suck so bad at censoring, that they will not edit out the cuss word completely, or miss a word or two and leave it in. Because they do such a poor job, it's pretty easy to infer a lot of the subject matter they want to "censor" in these songs. I'm not one to normally scream about censorship, however, 2K is rated E and basketball fans of all ages play it, so it should be up to snuff when it comes to this kind of stuff. 

Also, as an aside, the lyrical content which is NOT censored is often not great messaging either-- most of the song lyrics praise money, power, greed, consumerism, vanity, status, hustle-culture, etc. There's very few songs with good, or even neutral messaging here (though to be fair, from what I've heard there seem to be a couple). Again I'm not here to be the moral police, I just think a game that many kids will also play should be more considerate of these topics being present. 

There is STILL a bug where I have to go into the video settings every time I launch the game to change the refresh rate to the proper 120hz. If I don't, every time I launch the game it sets it at 119.9, and it causes significant studdering of the gameplay. This has been an issue since at least 2K22.

I ask again -- how did 2K manage to screw a product that is literally a copy-paste every year so badly?

This is easily the most insulting piece of software that I have ever purchased. It is a broken mess. And while it would of course be nice to have the next gen version on Steam, that's not even my issue. I knew it wasn't next gen before I purchased it. My issue is that it's broken. It crashes constantly. It crashes in the middle of games. It crashes while MyCareer is trying to load. And the only way to fix that problem is to load into another MyCareer file, load that character into the multiplayer arena, then go back to main menu and load the character I actually want to play as. I have to do that EVERYTIME I want to play a game. It's insulting that they are charging $60 for this and it annoys me that I gave it to them. I've just uninstalled this game and I don't think I'll be reinstalling it even if they fix it in the future (which they won't). Honestly, Steam should remove the listing. Maybe the multiplayer works. I don't know. I don't play multiplayer. But for everything else, this game is a broken mess. Do not buy it.

Most vile game of the year....

2K this year have instead opted in to scamming the community that have made this game. Everything in this game is locked behind micro-transactions. People could end spending 60 + hours trying to get somewhere, where someone could drop £80 on the game and have completed everything to do in it. New payable season pass, all the standard rewards are awful so it the game is trying to push everyone into a corner to have to spend money on the game. To get the new Kevin Durant Diamond card, you need to pay for 5 separate bundles of players worth around £50 each, to then be able to get the one card you want. That's upwards of £350+ for one virtual card....

Disgusting that a community of people that make your game are treated this way....

Maybe I hate change.....maybe I hate the fact that a bunch of people are getting paid way more than I do to sit around and ruin perfectly good games.  What was so wrong with the auction house? What is the point of team starter packs in MyTeam?  it seems like all you did was make it easier for yourselves to manage and way less fun.  I opened MyTeam and after hearing the intro and seeing how I am supposed to get excited about creating a perfect team of amethyst level players I didn't even have any interest in playing a game.   You do remember that last month we were all competing for dark matter cards?  How am I supposed to get excited about a new season of players that are inferior to the ones i was just playing with?  And you want me to pay another fee for a Pro Pass? Fuck you you gouging losers! I am so underwhelmed and disappointed with this version.   After the amount of money I spent on 2K23 last year I should have been contacted and asked if I wanted the next ten years free.
And the card art---why would you make them so boring?
So, I tried MyTeam and after 10mins of getting my ass handed to me on the lowest setting I realized that 2K has rigged the game so that you HAVE to spend money to have any chance of competing against domination teams on pro setting.  I played 2K23 and I KNOW i can win, but not against rigged teams that just frustrate you in to spending money on better cards.  I am just going to enjoy all the fruits of my labour on 2K23. I am imaginative with my gameplay and as long as there is an auction house running and other interested players I will play that game for the rest of my life.  Fuck you 2K for being progressively worse at your game development.  2K24 has been uninstalled and refund requested.  Unimpressive to an overwhelmingly disgusting degree.  What do you guys do? Just sit around and imagine ways to make your games less fun and inclusive as the years go by?  Once in a blue moon you guys do okay.....2K23 was tolerable without the spending----but if I am gonna spend hundreds, thousands of dollars into buying cards at least make an effort to make the cards look like some thought and work were put into them.  you did a GREAT job of this. in 2K23 and I read TONS of compliments and good reviews on this.....so, ummm, okay, lets reward our customers by making the cards BORING AF!!!!! Thanks.  the one thing that made it tolerable to spend my money as an adult on virtual player cards---and you take it away.  the auction house, which was a neat little game within the game----taken away.  IDIOTIC
and the new shot meters, plus now you have to use shot meters for quick layups?????  makes the game unnecessarily harder and so f--ing boring.  Why didn't you just stick with what worked?
maybe if it was offered to me free I would give it more of a chance but it just seems like spending my money on this game is rewarding people for a horrible job.  Please do better next year.....please cause i was really looking forward to this game and you guys really screwed the pooch on this one.

Look, I understand I'm part of the problem for buying this game. I honestly waste money on video games more than I should but I don't spend my extra income on anything else so I don't regret my purchases very often. 

Until now......... 

And it's not because the game is copy & paste or because of 2ks predatory dynamics(I don't play career anyways) it's because the games just broken. 

I had 2k23 and it worked great on ultra settings. 2k24 stutters like crazy even on low. I don't think it has anything to do with graphics settings as it plays the game at a high frame rate smoothly for 5 -10 seconds then freezes for a second. I think it's just a crap port they clearly don't care about. 

So besides that being impossible to deal with in a game that uses a timing mechanic to shoot, there is an even bigger problem. 

If the game crashes or you force close the app during a myLeague or myGM game it completely corrupts your save file and crashes the app when you try and load your save. 

So in conclusion. I got what I deserved but for others I'd like to help. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Even if you can look past 2k being greedy not caring about its customers, and the game still being last gen. None of that matters as the game is a broken mess.

If 2k23 was so grindy that even dame would run away from the grind, then 2k24 would make dame retire. I have played many grindy games in my life, but this game is by far the grindiest game and also one of the most unfun grinds ever compared to the last 2ks.

People get banned for being efficient at grinding vc by using the foul out method or some other game provided technique, meanwhile hackers and cheaters do not get banned at all.

I usually enjoy 2k, even though its inferior to the "next gen" console version, but its hard to find anything fun about this game.

PC 2k will never get next gen even though most of the 2k community could run next gen at least on medium. Forever we will be disrespected by 2k. Do they not realize that if they actually put effort into getting next gen on pc, then they would have a larger community playing which would increase their revenue in the long run?

Not to mention the fact that their anticheat is so weak on pc that its profitable to sell cheats to the community because they hardly ever try to stop cheaters on pc. Best of all, there is no report system in the game so you cant even report cheaters. You can try and write an email, but they won't do much about it.

NBA 2K24, just like its predecessors, is a example of how a franchise can become stagnant, offering very little innovation year after year. As a PC "Steam" player, my experience with this game has been nothing short of disappointing, plagued by inequality, mistreatment, bugs, and server issues. Unless you want to play MyTeam or a storyless 2k24 MyCareer, stay away from the game. The MyCareer feels so soul-sucking, it seriously is bland, lifeless, and is basically old MyCareer with current player building "which limits your stats and badges to a "99" overall". WASTE OF MONEY. don't waste your money, get 2k23 and use a created 24 roster, save $60 bucks. literally nothing new besides mamba moments. even the rookie animations aren't new, they're old animations from prior 2k games that they had taken away previously. this is one of the worst releases I've ever seen. 2k sports, you are all greedy you LIE to us PC Gamers you didn't say that the My Career on PC has no story it's like I'm playing My League. NBA 2K24 has left me feeling thoroughly disappointed, making it one of the weakest entries in the storied history of the NBA 2K franchise. With a price tag starting at $60, it's hard to justify the cost of what this game brings to the table.

Sure, there are some positives. NBA 2K24 introduces a handful of new animations and updated team rosters, which is expected in any annual sports game release. The revamped Jordan Challenge mode is historical Kobe Bryant mode now. These few additions hardly justify the price point.

The biggest issue is the lack of innovation and substantial improvements compared to its predecessors. It feels like a mere roster update with a few extra bells and whistles, rather than a genuine evolution of the franchise. For those who have been loyal fans and have seen multiple iterations of NBA 2K, this release feels stagnant and uninspiring.

I made the mistake of purchasing the game this year as part of my "default subscription", and I can't help but feel like I've overpaid for what I received. The inflated cost for updated team rosters is simply not justified, and it leaves me questioning whether I'll be willing to make the same purchase next year if 2K Sports offers a similar product.

In conclusion, NBA 2K24 is a lackluster entry in the NBA 2K series. While it maintains some of the franchise's core gameplay, it fails to bring enough new content and improvements to the table to warrant its price. Die-hard fans may find it hard to justify the expense, and I can only hope that future releases from 2K Sports will show a more substantial commitment to innovation and player satisfaction.

I played 2K for about 4 years now. Started at 2K20 and now I'm here. Sadly the game is not next gen which is obviously a huge disappointment every year. Though, you have the game mode "Play now with friends" which allows for teamup with friends, which is nice considering not even next gen lets you play this game mode. Though, the game is a lot more grindier and it cost more to upgrade your character. It was not like this previous 2K which sucks. Going against hackers and 90's overall while you are a 60 overall is not fun. This being our only option for basketball on PC, we are forced to buy this and play it while others are on next gen. The game feels different from last year just ever so slightly, as in its harder to shoot and balls are frequently picked/stolen. It gets the job done as it is our only option. 

Give us next gen next year. Would I recommend this game? No and yes, no because it's a bad game with a good amount of bugs and yes because its basketball

This game is okay... when it works... which is some of the time. Likes to freeze after finishing games, which is a ton of fun cause the results are lost. AI is pretty trash, but playable on lower difficulty settings. Shooting is impossible with lower tier players on higher difficulty. Computer constantly has fast breaks and wide open cuts to the basket for no reason other than user controlled team CPU players jog everywhere and don't react to anything regardless of defensive/hustle ratings, and lobs are fucking ridiculous (from the 3 point line from 70 overall PGs against HOF centers). HOF PGs like to dribble the ball out of bounds with any type of pressure from the defense (both user and CPU). Shot defense percentage is broken... wide open shots are considered defended if a CPU player is anywhere near the shooter for user, but almost all shots are wide open for the CPU. Team creation is cool, but images like to bug out and then you have to redo your jerseys, which is annoying at best. In summation... this game is okay. 3 stars, maybe worth $60 if you like basketball games. Definitely room for improvement. I have played every NBA2K since 2K11 and I have never been so disappointed that I wanted to write a review. This has been the best basketball game available for the last decade and still is, but the experience for a returning fan is poor. I knew this game would still be current gen before buying it so I'm not going to say that I was expecting next gen. But there are some huge flaws with the game that I will share from my offline experiences.

MyCareer:
The story mode in this game is terrible. The devs constantly adjust the story mode to please online park players, and it damages the MyCareer experience. Not having a story line is not an issue for me because MyCareer didn't used to have a story line, but my issue is that everything in this 2k is spoon-fed to you. You begin your career as the worst player in the NBA who somehow is starting at your position no matter what, even ahead of superstars. The game should punish you or reward you for your play, not just hand you minutes. The ridiculous prices for upgrades wouldn't be as unreasonable if they just started you at a normal rating. I created a player that is supposed to be a good three point shooter, and started with a bad three point rating. To completely upgrade just the three point rating, it would take me 200,000 VC, which costs $50 to purchase. I play 12 minute quarters and make about 1000 VC every game, to upgrade just one attribute it would take me 200 games, that is ridiculous. They need to separate the offline story from the park. If the story mode is your favorite part of the 2K games, this is definitely not worth it.

MyLeague:
I play MyLeague the most and I could go on forever about the flaws. The 2 biggest flaws are that they did not add the Clutch Player of the Year award to the game, and there still is no Transition Take Foul in the game. The Take Foul has been in the NBA for a while now, and this game is supposed to be a realistic simulator of NBA basketball, how have they not added this. Playing past more than a few seasons is not enjoyable, the default progression system results in really good players stuck in free agency and teams full of all-star level ratings from top to bottom. If you look at team stats, teams have record high Offensive Ratings every season and horrible defensive ratings, that is not realistic. MyLeague in its default state, in which it is supposed to simulate the real NBA season experience, is not playable for more than one season.

2K fans complain every year and still buy the game, but this is the first time that the game is actually worse than it is good. The game will never change because there aren't any competitors. This game is a slap in the face to Kobe Bryant, the NBA, and 2K fans. [b] NBA2K24 is an underwhelming depiction of the NBA and poorly accommodates the casual player base. [/b]
